person.persName: Martin Pickett Marshall (Mason Co. State Senator)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, attorney, farmer, and politician. Warrenton, Virginia, native. Son of Charles Marshall and Lucy P. Marshall. Married to Elizabeth Colston Marshall. Father of Charles Marshall, Frances Jane Marshall, Lucy Marshall, Mary Marshall, Robert Morris Marshall, Susan Marshall, and Phoebe Marshall. Studied under John Marshall in Richmond, Virginia, until 1816. Studied law with Alexander K. Marshall. Began practicing law in Paris, Kentucky, in 1818. Practiced law in Cincinnati, Ohio. Practiced law in Washington, Kentucky. Began practicing law in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1823. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Fleming County in 1825. Member of the Kentucky Constitutional Convention of 1849 from Fleming County. Farmer in Fleming County in 1850. Owned thirty-three enslaved people in Fleming County in 1850. Farmer in Washington in 1860. Owned eight enslaved people in Washington in 1860. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Mason County from 1861 to 1865.
